nl_statement:
7. II 1 (POL 2) Let $a_{i}, b_{i}$ be coprime positive integers for $i=1, 2, \ldots, k,$ . and $m$ the
least common multiple of $b_{1}, \ldots, b_{k}$ . Prove that the greatest common divisor of
$a_{1} \frac{m} {b_{1}}, \dots, a_{k} \frac{m} {b_{k}}$ equals the greatest common divisor of
$a_{1}, \ldots, a_{k}$ .\n
